member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.AnalysisModes
member.summary: Specifies how the functions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.AnalysisModes.AutomaticReconciliationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the InkAnalyzer automatically starts the reconciliation operation as soon as the intermediate or final results are ready. If this mode is enabled, the event is not raised. If this mode is disabled, the event is raised.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.AnalysisModes.Default
member.summary: All modes are enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.AnalysisModes.None
member.summary: No modes are enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.AnalysisModes.PersonalizationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether personalization is enabled. If the recognizers support personalization, the personalized data will be used to improve accuracy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.AnalysisModes.StrokeCacheAutoCleanupEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the automatically clears unneeded strokes from the stroke cache before performing analysis. If this mode is enabled, the clears the stroke data before performing analysis. Your code must also then handle the event. If the event is not handled, an exception is raised. This check is done both at the Analyze (or BackgroundAnalyze) and Reconciliation phases. If this mode is disabled, the does not clear the stroke data. To clear the stroke data, call . If this mode is disabled, the event is raised so the can retrieve the latest stroke data for any strokes that have had their cache cleared. If the stroke cache is cleared, but the event is not handled, an exception is raised.

member.summary: Indicates that there are not any ink recognizers that meet the language or capabilities needed to perform the text recognition operation installed on the system. No recognizer was found supporting both that particular language id and the hint capabilities that the application required. member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities
member.summary: Defines values that specify the attributes of an ink recognizer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.AdviseInkChange
member.summary: Supports interrupting background recognition, such as when the ink has changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.ArbitraryAngle
member.summary: Supports text written at arbitrary angles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.BoxedInput
member.summary: Supports boxed input, where each character or word is entered in a box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.CharacterAutoCompletionInput
member.summary: Supports character Autocomplete. Recognizers that support character Autocomplete require boxed input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.DoNotCare
member.summary: Ignores all other flags that are set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.DownAndLeft
member.summary: Supports handwriting input in down and left order, such as in some East Asian languages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.DownAndRight
member.summary: Supports handwriting input in down and right order, such as in some East Asian languages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.FreeInput
member.summary: Supports free input, where ink is entered without the use of a recognition guide, such as a line or a box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.Lattice
member.summary: Supports returning a object as an alternative to Stringhttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemstringclasstopic.asp for handwriting recognition results.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.LeftAndDown
member.summary: Supports handwriting input in left and down order, such as in Hebrew and Arabic languages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.LinedInput
member.summary: Supports lined input, which is similar to writing on lined paper.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.None
member.summary: No capabilities specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.Object
member.summary: Supports object recognition; otherwise, recognizes only text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.Personalizable
member.summary: Supports personalized handwriting, where the recognizer improves recognition when exposed to the same handwriting over time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.PrefersArbitraryAngle
member.summary: Supports that the need not rotate the handwriting to a horizontal orientation before sending the ink to the .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.PrefersParagraphBreaking
member.summary: Indicates that the should send entire paragraphs of ink to the , allowing the InkRecognizers to do the Line breaking and Word (or character) breaking.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.PrefersSegmentationRecognition
member.summary: Indicates that the will send the indvidual ink words (or characters depending on the language) when recognizing, instead of sending entire lines of writing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.RightAndDown
member.summary: Supports handwriting input in right and down order, such as in western languages and some East Asian languages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkRecognizerCapabilities.StrokeReorder
member.summary: Supports that stroke order—spatial and temporal—is handled as part of the recognition operation. The does not reorder strokes before sending ink to the .
